overview.whatIsEasyKanbanDesc1: Easy Kanban is a comprehensive project management platform that combines Kanban boards, Gantt charts, and list views for complete project visibility. It features real-time collaboration, advanced task management, and team coordination tools.
overview.whatIsEasyKanbanDesc2: The application supports multiple project boards, task dependencies, file attachments, rich text editing, and sophisticated filtering. It's designed for teams of all sizes with role-based permissions and admin controls.
overview.boardSelector: Board Selector: Switch between different project boards using the tab interface at the top. Each board can have its own columns and tasks. Use the scroll arrows to navigate through many boards.
overview.viewModes: View Modes: Toggle between Kanban (visual board), List (table format), and Gantt (timeline) views using the Tools panel.
overview.searchFilter: Search & Filter: Use the search interface to filter tasks by text, dates, members, priorities, tags, and more. Save filter views for quick access.
overview.userProfile: User Profile: Access your profile settings, preferences, and account information via the user menu in the top-right.
overview.activityFeed: Activity Feed: View real-time updates, changes, and team activity in the draggable activity panel.
overview.adminPanel: Admin Panel: Administrators can access user management, system settings, and configuration options.
overview.teamMembers: Team Members: Each member gets a unique color for easy identification. Administrators can add, edit, or invite new team members through the Admin panel.
overview.memberSelection: Member Selection: Select specific team members to filter tasks, or use "Clear" to see everyone's tasks. You must also enable at least one role below to see filtered results.
overview.roleBasedFiltering: Role-Based Filtering: filter tasks by different member roles:
overview.assignees: Assignees: Show tasks assigned to the selected team members
overview.watchers: Watchers: Show tasks that the selected team members are watching
overview.collaborators: Collaborators: Show tasks that the selected team members can collaborate on
overview.requesters: Requesters: Show tasks requested by the selected team members
overview.system: System: Show tasks assigned to the system user (admin only)
overview.AllRoles: Click the "All Roles" button to show all tasks from all member roles.
overview.views: Views: Switch between Kanban (visual board), List (table format), and Gantt (timeline) views using the Tools panel.
overview.searchFilterTools: Search & Filter: Advanced filtering by text, dates, members, priorities, tags, and project IDs. Save and share filter views.
overview.taskViewModes: Task View Modes: Toggle between compact and detailed task views to optimize screen space.
overview.activityFeedTools: Activity Feed: Draggable panel showing real-time changes, comments, and team activity with notification badges.
overview.userProfileTools: User Profile: Manage account settings, preferences, avatar, and personal information.
overview.realtimeCollaboration: Real-time Collaboration: See live updates as team members work on tasks and boards.
overview.keyboardShortcuts: Keyboard Shortcuts: Use F1 for help, keyboard navigation for efficiency.
overview.sprintsDesc1: Sprints are time-based planning periods used to organize tasks and track progress over specific date ranges. Administrators create and manage sprints through the Admin panel.
overview.sprintsDesc2: Each sprint has a name, start date, end date, and optional description. One sprint can be marked as "Active" to serve as the default selection in filters and reports.
overview.sprintFilter: Sprint Filter: Use the sprint filter in the application header to view all sprints, the backlog (unassigned tasks), or filter tasks by a specific sprint. The filter shows task counts for each sprint.
overview.clearButton: Clear Button: Click the "Clear" button to deselect all team members. When no members are selected, all tasks from all members are displayed (equivalent to selecting everyone).

kanban.overviewDesc1: The Kanban view displays tasks as cards organized in columns representing different stages of your workflow. This visual approach helps teams understand work progress at a glance.
kanban.overviewDesc2: Your board starts with 4 default columns: To Do, In Progress, Testing, and Completed. Columns can be customized, reordered, and deleted as needed.
kanban.overviewDesc3: Tasks can be dragged between columns to update their status, and within columns to change priority order.
kanban.createColumns: Create Columns: Click the three-dot menu (⋮) in any column header and select "Add Column" to create a new column. The new column will be inserted after the current column.
kanban.renameColumns: Rename Columns: Double-click column headers to edit their names directly.
kanban.reorderColumns: Reorder Columns: Drag column headers to reorder them according to your workflow (admin only).
kanban.deleteColumns: Delete Columns: Use the three-dot menu (⋮) in the column header and select "Delete Column" to remove columns (admin only).
kanban.finishedColumns: Finished Columns: Columns with names like "Done", "Completed", or "Finished" are automatically marked as finished. Tasks in these columns won't be considered overdue.
kanban.createTasks: Create Tasks: First select team members using the checkboxes, then click the "+" button in any column header to create a new task. The task will be automatically assigned to the currently logged-in user.
kanban.editTasks: Edit Tasks: Click the pen icon for quick edits, or the info icon for detailed editing with rich text, attachments, and comments.
kanban.moveTasks: Move Tasks: Drag and drop tasks between columns to update their status. Visual feedback shows valid drop zones.
kanban.reorderTasks: Reorder Tasks: Drag tasks up or down within a column to change their priority order.
kanban.copyTasks: Copy Tasks: Use the copy icon to duplicate existing tasks with all their properties.
kanban.deleteTasks: Delete Tasks: Click the trash icon in the task toolbar to remove tasks. Confirmation may be required based on admin settings.
kanban.taskDetails: Task Details: Click the info icon to open the full task editor with comments, attachments, watchers, and collaborators.
kanban.editTasksSprint: Associate with Sprint: Click the calendar icon on a task card to open the sprint selector and assign the task to a sprint or move it to the backlog.
kanban.editTasksQuick: Quick Edit: Click the pen icon on a task card for quick edits to title, description, and other basic fields.
kanban.editTasksDates: Change Dates: Click directly on any date field (start date or due date) in the task card to open the date picker and modify the dates.
kanban.editTasksAssignee: Change Assignee: Click on the assignee avatar in the top-right corner of the task card to open the member selector and change who the task is assigned to.
kanban.editTasksPriority: Change Priority: Click on the priority indicator on the task card to open the priority selector and change the task priority level.
kanban.taskDetailsClick: Open Task Details: Click anywhere on a task card to open the full task details modal with all editing options, comments, attachments, and relationships.
kanban.taskToolbar: Task Toolbar: When hovering over a task card, a toolbar appears with buttons for: Add Comment, Add Tag, Copy Task, Link Task (to create relationships), Archive Task (if archive column exists), and Delete Task. The drag handle in the top-left corner allows you to move tasks between columns.
kanban.crossColumnMovement: Cross-Column Movement: Drag tasks from one column to another to update their status.
kanban.withinColumnReordering: Within-Column Reordering: Drag tasks up or down within a column to change their priority.
kanban.visualFeedback: Visual Feedback: The interface shows drop zones and highlights where tasks can be placed.
kanban.autoSave: Auto-Save: Changes are automatically saved when you drop tasks in new positions.
kanban.taskInformation: Task Information: Set title, description, effort, priority, start date, due date, and assign requester. Rich text editor supports formatting and links.
kanban.comments: Comments: Add rich text comments with file attachments to discuss task progress, ask questions, or provide updates.
kanban.attachments: Attachments: Upload files and documents related to the task using the paperclip icon. Multiple file types supported.
kanban.priorityLevels: Priority Levels: Customizable priority system with colors and names defined by administrators.
kanban.tags: Tags: Add custom tags with colors to categorize and filter tasks. Tags are managed by administrators.
kanban.watchers: Watchers: Add team members as watchers to receive notifications when tasks are updated.
kanban.collaborators: Collaborators: Add team members as collaborators who can edit and comment on tasks.
kanban.taskRelationships: Task Relationships: Link tasks as parent-child or related relationships for project organization.

list.overviewDesc1: The List view displays all tasks in a table format, making it easy to see detailed information at a glance and perform bulk operations.
list.overviewDesc2: This view is perfect for data analysis, reporting, and managing large numbers of tasks efficiently. It supports horizontal scrolling for many columns.
list.overviewDesc3: Tasks are organized by columns and can be sorted, filtered, and managed in bulk.
list.showHideColumns: Show/Hide Columns: Click the column menu button to toggle which columns are visible.
list.resizeColumns: Resize Columns: Drag column borders to adjust width for better readability.
list.defaultColumns: Default Columns: ID, Task, Assignee, Priority, Status, Start Date, Due Date, Tags, Comments, Created
list.columnPersistence: Column Persistence: Your column preferences are saved and restored between sessions.
list.horizontalScrolling: Horizontal Scrolling: Use scroll controls to navigate through many columns efficiently.
list.sortByColumn: Sort by Column: Click any column header to sort tasks by that field (ascending/descending).
list.multiLevelSorting: Multi-Level Sorting: Hold Shift while clicking headers to sort by multiple columns.
list.searchIntegration: Search Integration: Use the search panel to filter tasks by text, dates, members, priorities, tags, and project IDs.
list.savedFilters: Saved Filters: Save frequently used filter combinations for quick access and sharing with team members.
list.advancedFiltering: Advanced Filtering: Filter by assignees, watchers, collaborators, requesters, and system tasks.
list.quickActions: Quick Actions: Hover over task rows to reveal action buttons (View, Copy, Delete).
list.statusChanges: Status Changes: Use dropdown menus to quickly change task status between columns.
list.directEditing: Direct Editing: Click on editable fields to modify task information directly.
list.taskDetails: Task Details: Click the task title or desciption to open the full task editor with all features.
list.richText: Rich Text: Task descriptions support rich text formatting, links, and embedded content.
list.dateFormatting: Date Formatting: Dates are displayed in a consistent, readable format with timezone awareness.
list.priorityIndicators: Priority Indicators: Color-coded priority levels with customizable colors and names.
list.memberAvatars: Member Avatars: Assignee information includes member avatars, names, and color coding.
list.tagDisplay: Tag Display: Tags are shown as colored badges for easy categorization and filtering.
list.commentCounts: Comment Counts: Visual indicators show the number of comments and attachments on each task.
list.statusIndicators: Status Indicators: Clear visual indicators for task status, overdue items, and completion state.
list.exportDesc: Export your task data to CSV or Excel format for analysis, reporting, or backup purposes. The export feature is available to administrators only and can be accessed via the download icon in the List View header.
list.exportFormats: Export Formats: Choose between CSV (comma-separated values) for simple data exchange or Excel (XLSX) format for advanced spreadsheet features with multiple sheets.
list.exportScopes: Export Scopes: Export tasks from the current board only, or export all tasks from all boards in your workspace. When exporting all boards, Excel format creates separate sheets for each board plus a summary sheet.
list.exportFields: Export Fields: Exported data includes sprint, ticket ID, task title, description (HTML stripped), assignee, priority, status, start date, due date, effort, tags, comments (HTML stripped), created date, updated date, project identifier, and board name.
list.exportExcel: Excel Features: When exporting all boards to Excel, each board gets its own sheet with properly formatted columns and widths. A summary sheet combines all tasks with an additional board column for easy cross-board analysis.

gantt.overviewDesc1: The Gantt view displays tasks as horizontal bars on a timeline, showing task durations, dependencies, and project progress over time.
gantt.overviewDesc2: This view is ideal for project planning, resource allocation, and understanding task relationships and deadlines. It features virtual scrolling for large projects.
gantt.overviewDesc3: Tasks can be dragged to change dates, resized to adjust duration, and linked with dependency arrows.
gantt.scrollNavigation: Scroll Navigation: Use scroll bars to navigate through time periods.
gantt.todayButton: Today Button: Click the "Today" button to jump to the current date on the timeline.
gantt.taskNavigation: Task Navigation: Use the arrow buttons to jump to the earliest or latest tasks in the timeline.
gantt.relationshipMode: Relationship Mode: Toggle relationship mode to create task dependencies and links.
gantt.createTasks: Create Tasks: Click on any date in the timeline to create a new task on that date. Drag across multiple dates to set a date range for the task.
gantt.editTasks: Edit Tasks: Click on task bars to open the task editor for detailed modifications.
gantt.resizeTasks: Resize Tasks: Drag the edges of task bars to adjust start and end dates.
gantt.moveTasks: Move Tasks: Drag task bars horizontally to change their timeline position.
gantt.reorderTasks: Reorder Tasks: Drag tasks vertically to change their priority order within columns.
gantt.copyTasks: Copy Tasks: Use the copy button to duplicate tasks with all their properties.
gantt.deleteTasks: Delete Tasks: Use the delete button to remove tasks from the timeline.
gantt.createDependencies: Create Dependencies: Click and drag from one task to another to create dependency relationships.
gantt.dependencyTypes: Dependency Types: Set parent-child and related task relationships with visual arrows.
gantt.visualArrows: Visual Arrows: Dependencies are shown as arrows connecting related tasks on the timeline.
gantt.cycleDetection: Cycle Detection: The system prevents circular dependencies to maintain project integrity.
gantt.taskRelationships: Task Relationships: Link tasks as parent-child or related for better project organization.
gantt.timelineNavigationDesc: Timeline Navigation: Scroll horizontally through time periods and zoom in/out for different time scales.
gantt.todayIndicator: Today Indicator: A vertical line shows the current date on the timeline for reference.
gantt.lateBadge: Late Badge: Overdue tasks are highlighted to draw attention to tasks that are past their due date.
gantt.columnOrganization: Column Organization: Tasks are organized by columns (workflow stages) for better project structure.
gantt.realtimeUpdatesTimeline: Real-time Updates: Changes from team members are reflected immediately in the timeline.
gantt.virtualScrolling: Virtual Scrolling: Large projects with many tasks are handled efficiently with virtual scrolling for smooth performance.
gantt.lazyLoading: Lazy Loading: Task details and relationships are loaded on-demand to improve performance.
gantt.realtimeUpdates: Real-time Updates: Changes from team members are reflected immediately in the timeline.
gantt.keyboardShortcuts: Keyboard Shortcuts: Use keyboard shortcuts for quick navigation and editing.
gantt.performanceMonitoring: Performance Monitoring: Built-in performance monitoring ensures smooth operation with large datasets.

reports.overviewDesc: The Reports section provides comprehensive analytics and insights into team performance, task completion, burndown charts, and detailed task listings. Reports can be filtered by date ranges, boards, and other criteria.
reports.myStatsDesc: View your personal performance dashboard showing total points, tasks completed, effort completed, comments added, and collaborations. Includes monthly performance breakdown and achievements (if gamification is enabled).
reports.leaderboardDesc: See team rankings based on points, tasks completed, effort, comments, and collaborations. Filter by year and month to view historical leaderboards. Only visible when gamification and leaderboard features are enabled.
reports.burndownDesc: Track planned vs actual task completion over time. The burndown chart shows remaining tasks and effort, with ideal burndown lines for comparison. Filter by date range and board to analyze specific periods. Daily snapshots are created at midnight UTC.
reports.teamPerformanceDesc: View team-wide activity metrics including tasks created, completed, updated, comments added, collaborations, and total effort completed. Filter by date range and board to analyze team productivity over specific periods.
reports.taskListDesc: Generate comprehensive lists of tasks with detailed information including task ID, title, board, status, assignee, priority, effort, dates, tags, and comment counts. Filter by date range, board, status, assignee, and priority. Export or print reports for documentation.

admin.overviewDesc: The Admin panel provides comprehensive management tools for administrators to configure the application, manage users, and customize settings. All admin tabs are accessible only to users with admin role.
admin.usersDesc: Manage user accounts, roles, and permissions. Create new users, invite users via email, edit user information, activate/deactivate accounts, promote users to admin, and delete users. Configure user display names, colors, and authentication methods.
admin.usersSystemUser: System User: Tasks are automatically reassigned to the system user account when a user is deleted. This preserves project history and maintains data integrity by preventing orphaned tasks.
admin.usersOwnerUser: Owner Account: The account owner cannot change their email address. This ensures the owner account remains permanently associated with the license and system configuration.
admin.siteSettingsDesc: Configure global site settings including site name, language preferences, timezone, date formats, and other application-wide configurations that affect all users.
admin.siteSettingsUrl: Site URL: The Site URL should be set to your Kanban application's public URL. This URL appears as a clickable title in the application header, allowing users to quickly access the site.
admin.ssoDesc: Configure Single Sign-On (SSO) authentication using Google OAuth. Enable or disable Google login, configure OAuth credentials, and manage authentication providers for the application.
admin.ssoGoogleOnly: Google SSO: Currently, only Google OAuth is supported for Single Sign-On. The SSO configuration is self-managed, requiring you to set up and maintain your own Google OAuth credentials.
admin.mailServerDesc: Configure email server settings for sending notifications, invitations, and other emails. Set up SMTP server details, authentication, and test email functionality.
admin.mailServerTesting: Email Testing: Use the test email functionality to verify your SMTP configuration before enabling notifications. This helps ensure that users receive important system emails and notifications reliably.
admin.tagsDesc: Create, edit, and manage task tags. Tags are used to categorize and filter tasks. Configure tag names, colors, and descriptions. Delete tags and reassign associated tasks.
admin.prioritiesDesc: Manage task priority levels. Create custom priority levels with names and colors, set default priorities, reorder priorities, and configure which priorities are available for tasks.
admin.prioritiesDefault: Default Priority: Setting a default priority ensures that new tasks are automatically assigned an appropriate priority level. This helps maintain consistency across your project workflow.
admin.appSettingsDesc: Configure application-level settings including feature toggles, behavior settings, and application-specific configurations that control how the app functions.
admin.appSettingsLanguage: Default Language: Setting the default application language ensures that system-generated content is displayed in the selected language. This includes column names created during new board setup, activity feed messages, and email notifications sent to users.
admin.projectSettingsDesc: Manage project-related settings including project identifiers, board configurations, and project-specific customizations.
admin.projectSettingsIdentifiers: Project Identifiers: Project identifiers help organize and distinguish tasks across multiple projects. They appear in task tickets and can be used for filtering and reporting purposes.
admin.sprintSettingsDesc: Create and manage sprints (planning periods) for organizing tasks by time periods. Set sprint names, start/end dates, descriptions, and mark sprints as active. Sprints are used in reports and for filtering tasks.
admin.sprintSettingsImportant: Sprint Creation: It is important to create sprints before associating tasks with them. Tasks can only be assigned to existing sprints, so plan your sprint schedule in advance to ensure proper task organization and tracking.
admin.reportingDesc: Configure reporting and analytics settings including enabling/disabling reports module, gamification features, leaderboard visibility, achievements system, and other reporting-related configurations.
admin.reportingGamification: Gamification: When enabled, gamification features track user points, achievements, and leaderboard rankings based on task completion, effort, and collaboration. This can help motivate team members and recognize contributions.
admin.licensingDesc: View and manage application licensing information, license keys, subscription details, and licensing-related settings.

steps.welcome: Welcome to Easy Kanban! This is your main navigation area where you can switch between different boards.
steps.boardTabs: These are your board tabs. Click on any tab to switch between different project boards.
steps.kanbanColumns: This is your Kanban board! Tasks are organized in columns. You can drag and drop tasks between columns to update their status.
steps.addTaskButton: Click the "+" button on any column to add a new task. This is the main way to create new work items.
steps.searchFilter: Use the search and filter tools to find specific tasks. You can filter by assignee, tags, priority, and more.
steps.viewModeToggle: Switch between different view modes: Kanban (default), List view, or Gantt chart to see your tasks in different ways.
steps.teamMembers: Filter tasks by team members. Click on member avatars to show only their tasks, or use the "Clear" button to see everyone.
steps.profileMenu: Click on your profile to access settings, view your profile, or logout.
steps.helpButton: Need help? Click the help button (or press F1) anytime to open the help guide.
steps.addBoardButton: As an admin, you can create new boards by clicking this "+" button. Boards help organize different projects or teams.
steps.adminTab: The Admin panel provides comprehensive management tools for your Kanban application. Use this section to manage users, boards, columns, settings, and more.
steps.adminUsers: In the admin panel, manage team members, create new users, and assign roles.
steps.adminBoards: Create, rename, and delete boards. Organize your workspace with multiple project boards.
steps.columnManagementMenu: As an admin, use the three-dot menu on any column header to add new columns or delete existing ones. This helps you customize your workflow to match your team's process.
steps.adminSiteSettings: Configure your site's basic settings including site name and URL. The site URL is used as a clickable title in the application header.
steps.adminTags: Create and manage tags to categorize and organize your tasks effectively.
steps.adminPriorities: Set up priority levels for your tasks to help team members understand urgency.
steps.adminAppSettings: Configure application settings, user preferences, and system behavior in the App Settings tab.
steps.adminProjectSettings: Manage project-specific settings, workflows, and custom configurations in Project Settings.
steps.adminLicensing: View and manage your license information, usage limits, and subscription details.
steps.systemUsagePanel: This system usage panel shows real-time resource monitoring: RAM usage, CPU usage, and disk space. It helps you monitor your instance performance and resource consumption.
steps.sprintSelector: Use the Sprint Selector to filter tasks by sprint. You can view all sprints, the backlog (unassigned tasks), or a specific sprint. This helps you focus on tasks for a particular time period.
steps.themeToggle: Switch between light and dark mode using the theme toggle. Choose the appearance that works best for you.
steps.inviteUserButton: As an admin, you can invite new users to join your team. Click the invite button and enter their email address to send an invitation.
steps.reportsButton: Access the Reports section to view analytics and insights about team performance, task completion, burndown charts, and detailed task listings. Reports are available when enabled in settings.
steps.taskCardToolbar: Hover over a task card to see the toolbar with quick actions. You can assign members, change priority, add tags, copy tasks, and more without opening the task details.
steps.taskQuickEdit: Click the pen icon on a task card to open the quick edit modal. This allows you to quickly update task details like title, description, assignee, priority, and dates without opening the full task details panel.
steps.sprintAssociation: Click the calendar icon on a task card to associate it with a sprint. This helps organize tasks by time periods and track progress within specific sprints.
steps.exportMenu: In List View, admins can export tasks to CSV or XLSX format. Use the export menu in the table header to download task data for analysis or reporting.
steps.columnVisibility: In List View, you can show or hide columns to customize your view. Click the menu icon in the table header to toggle column visibility.
steps.adminSso: Configure Single Sign-On (SSO) authentication using Google OAuth. Enable or disable Google login and manage OAuth credentials.
steps.adminMailServer: Configure email server settings for sending notifications, invitations, and other system emails. Set up SMTP server details and test email functionality.
steps.adminSprintSettings: Create and manage sprints for your projects. Sprints are time-based planning periods used to organize tasks and track progress. Set sprint names, dates, and mark active sprints.
steps.adminReporting: Configure reporting features including gamification, leaderboard visibility, and achievement settings. Enable or disable various reporting capabilities for your team.
steps.systemPanelToggle: Use this button to show or hide the system metrics panel. When enabled, you'll see real-time monitoring of RAM, CPU, and disk usage. Your preference is saved and will persist across sessions.
